name: InterContinental Sydney

reviews.text: Terrific hotel. Convenient to Circular Quay and many attractions. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet is very nice, with many international selections.
reviews.title: Spectacular Hotel

reviews.text: I had a nice view of the Harbour Bridge, even though I didn't pay extra to book a room with the view. I loved everything about this hotel. The furnishings were exquisite and the bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Quality hotel in a central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool closed early, which was kind of disappointing, but it certainly would not deter me from staying here again.
reviews.title: Wow!

likes.liked: — The views, location and convenience! The bathroom in our room.

reviews.title: worth every penny
reviews.text: Smart hotel in a great central location. Friendly staff as always in Australia. Very comfortable rooms. Not cheap, but worth it.
We have stayed in different hotels in Sydney on our trips to Australia and this would have to be one of the best for location & convenience to Circular Quay and an outstanding high quality hotel.
reviews.title: What a nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our 21st Wedding anniversary on 23rd and 24th May. We have been to the Cafe Opera Restaurant many times for Sunday lunch and as they had a great deal for breakfast, late 5pm check out and valet parking we grabbed it.
reviews.title: Great Style, Fabulous Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a room on the 21st floor looking over the Botanical Gardens, we wanted a smoking room and the whole floor was smoking which was great. A complimentaty bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary was a fabulous touch and arrived in an ice bucket 10 minutes after we arrived. The room was clean, modern and the hotel is just very special. From check in to check out it was professional and efficient and so close to Circular Quay and the museums, art galleries, shopping and the botanic gardens! We would definitely stay here again, a nice part of town.
reviews.title: Perfect time at the Intercontinental

reviews.text: My husband and I stay at the Intercontinental Sydney for one night as a special treat on a weekend. We used TripAdvisor to make the choice of where to stay - and I am so glad that we 'listened' to everyone and booked the Intercontinental.
reviews.title: Excellent five star venue
A great del for an amzing hotel
reviews.text: We booked a deal which included breakfast, valet parking and late checkout, which was terrific value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were absolutely amazing - everyone from the receptionist, to the porters, to the cleaners made a point of being kind, and asking us how our stay was going.
reviews.title: Great location but nothing special otherwise

reviews.text: Stayed in the Intercontinental during a business trip for more than a week.
reviews.title: Where did the 5 Stars come from?

reviews.text: Typical business hotel with very litlle offering for family travel or similar. Best feature is definitely the location, right next to the beautiful botanical garden and close to the ferry pier.
reviews.title: Club superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in was smooth and efficient and amazingly my room was ready although it was only 11am. The room overalls are very small, the bathroom even smaller.
reviews.title: Not a 5 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping did an excellent job and the room was spotless and they went to great lenght everyday to tidy up the place.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The gym on the top floor has an excellent view and not much more. Unfortunately during my stay the pool was closed for renovation so cannot comment on that.
reviews.title: Outstanding view, but falls short overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our visit to Sydney for our 25 year anniversary. We honeymooned there and my husband thought it would be romantic to go back. We only had 8 days so it was a long flight from California but well worth it. We picked this hotel because of trip advisor reviews. We weren't disappointed. We paid for a east harbor view but were upgraded to a full harbor view. There is hardly a prettier sight anywhere in the world. They light up the bridge and the harbor is spectacular. They have a little seat by the window where you can just soak up the beauty, day and night. What a great city and a great hotel. The staff were very responsive and went above and beyond. One night we couldn't get our internet to work in the room and they sent two individuals to come and work on it. They also never ask for tips and they seem to have a real desire to just help out. The concierge won some international award for being the best in the business. The only negative is that the restaurants are quite expensive. We did celebrate our 25th at the hotel restaurant, Etch. It was fabulous. Great place. Sydney is super expensive for Americans but the hotel is fabulous.
reviews.title: amazing staff

reviews.text: I stayed here a few weeks ago for a meeting. I arrived after 9pm, and so checkin and concierge service was prompt.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious, and the blockout blind for the window worked well.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but nothing special for 5 star

reviews.text: Bed was OK with lots of pillows.
reviews.title: Great hotel, very happy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was starting to look a little tired, but the shower worked nicely, and good bright lighting.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but something was a bit 'off'

reviews.text: I have stayed here for a short business trip and booked this hotel as soon as I knew I was going to Sydney. I heard so much about it, especially about the Club lounge and the "Best View" of Opera House and Bridge in the city.
reviews.title: One of the most famous and favorite InterContinentals in the world - all for the right reasons.

reviews.text: The hotel pleased me a lot, because of :
reviews.title: This hotel's got the views

reviews.text: A) Location, Location, Location
reviews.title: Great wedding night accommodation!

reviews.text: B) service. Especially since they employ and train so many young people with great ambitions and great customer service, this is definitely good.
reviews.title: Poorest intercontinental experience to date

reviews.text: C) one of the best Club lounges am. InterContinental can offer. Even tops the one in Dubai...
reviews.title: Just what you'd expect of a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: The management of this property seemed to have a policy to "upsell" and "capture extra revenue" at any cost. Employees will sell you the harbor view for extra $50 a night. $150 a day to use the executive lounge, $30 for an umbrella, $60 for the wireless Internet and it doesn't stop. Things that other properties would give you as an amenity because of your Platinum status, here they chose to charge. and they recognize other hotels in the chain give amenities but they say they can't afford doing it.
reviews.title: Just stay away....not kidding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will kid you not. When I asked what were the benefits for being a platinum member, the girl at the reception replied "you are able to earn points.....oh....and also redeem them!!" Woooow. All this was even before checking in.
reviews.title: let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will find a small run down, dirty carpet, overused mattresses room. Poor lighting and and old AC system. The bathroom is small, old and probably more a motel 6 type. They know about it an say that all rooms are the same, except the suites, which of course are their excuse to squeeze you $400 extra a night.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I saw the general manager answers some reviews here so I decided to give him a call to discuss my points of view, while at the hotel. I got his assistant voice mail, a manager on duty and then an excuse that he was out. Never heard from him. I guess it's easier to just reply to tripadvisor comments once the damage is done, although very, very expensive Mr Fred.
reviews.title: The Good and the Not So Good

reviews.text: The hotel has a good location. The lobby is very small and old. The restaurant and lobby bar are not nice and give you the impression of being more a holiday inn or a 4 starts hotel type. Poor lighting and cold ambiance.
reviews.title: Wonderful service made for a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent two nights for our wedding at the Intercontinental. Having done a lot of research on hotels in Sydney we decided that this looked the best of the luxury hotels. Sadly, we had quite a mixed experience there, and I do not feel that the price paid for the room reflects the experience we had.
reviews.title: Not quite we had expected...

likes.disliked: — Price / value, initial arrival in the room was unsatisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side, the room was nice, the breakfasts were very good and the staff we dealt with throughout were friendly and professional. And a very nice bottle of bubbly and rose petals on our wedding night.
reviews.title: Brilliant

likes.disliked: — The strange window from the bathroom into the room

reviews.text: On the negative side, on arrival in the room I found an envelope / receipt addressed to another guest, a guest survey filled in by the previous guest (interestingly, also unhappy too) and toilet paper in the lavatory. To be fair to the staff, I reported this and received a nice apology letter and bottle of bubbly.
reviews.title: Another Pleasant Stay

likes.liked: — Club Floor Lounge and Location of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we got to the room on the Thursday night at about 11.30pm it was like entering a nightclub, with terribly loud music from somewhere. Again, I had to contact the duty manager to report the problem, and it was resolved by about midnight but not quite what you would expect of a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: InterContinental Magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, I left the flat on the Friday morning and my other half went there to get ready for the wedding (hair and make-up and so on). As such, I requested with the front desk on the Thursday night that the room be made-up at 9.15 so it was nice and presentable for the bridal party, and was told that this would occur. However nothing had been done for their arrival.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, fantastic location, excellent service

reviews.text: This was a business trip that we extended to include several days of play. The hotel was absolutely stunning and the location was perfect. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a wonderful view of the harbor, the bridge, the opera house and the gardens. The staff was eager to do anything they could to help. The location was ideal because we enjoyed several days of just walking out of the hotel and walking the city. It was close to everything for the city and easy to get transportation to things further away.
reviews.title: Perfect stay, perfect trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expensive hotel, expensive room service but for a wonderful stay in a historic, beautiful location, the Intercontinental is your place.
reviews.title: Good location and views

reviews.text: Excellent location and views. From our corner room we could see Observatory Hill, Bridge, Botanic Gardens and up the harbour to the heads. Shame about the big building blocking the view to the Opera House.
reviews.title: Great in everyway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was excellent without being stunning... Service was ok although front desk seemed a little unsure of themselves at times when asked fairly simple questions. eg. Asking for a razor that was eventually able to be supplied.
reviews.title: very convinience place and close to opera house
Great location
reviews.text: I would stay here again if looking for a nice hotel downtown in the city.

Stayed at the Intercon when we missed our flight home. This hotel has an amazing location! Not even two blocks from Circular Quay- with the Harbor Bridge and Opera House for your enjoyment. There are many restaurants and bars all in the area and the ferries are all right there as well-- making it easy to explore! The hotel staff was great and the rooms were wonderful.
reviews.title: Perfect place in Sydney!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great price of Expedia- a mystery room. We weren't too fussed about where we were staying & at that price the room and the view was lovely. The bathroom was old and needs to be updated.
reviews.title: Great location but bathroom needs updating

reviews.text: I recently stayed for a week at the Intercontinental in Sydney. My room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was consistently helpful and friendly. We were able to negotiate a room rate that included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was great with lots of fresh fruit and yogurt as well as the traditional eggs, sausage, muffins...
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.text: The location was perfect as it was within walking distance of our office as well as a plentiful choice of restaurants for dinner.
reviews.title: A very Good Experience

reviews.text: The only negative was that Internet access was pricey. If I have the opportunity to visit Sydney again, the only reason I wouldn't stay at the Intercontinental was if I could get free Internet access at a hotel of the same caliber like the Westin.
reviews.title: Don't event think about staying here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry to disagree with other reviews on this hotel, but my experience was totally the opposite!
reviews.title: Cold Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly: Priority Club Membership ‘Benefits’:
reviews.title: Excellent Property

reviews.text: Upon check in, my platinum status and the fact it was the first stop on our honeymoon, was not recognised at all. (Incidentally why does nobody ever seem to man the Priority Club check in areas?) Thankfully we checked in early around 11AM, but when I asked what benefits I could hope to expect during my stay I received the abrupt reply that the hotel was full and there would be no upgrades available. When I asked about access to the club lounge a ludicrous figure of AUD400 per night was quoted and that it was a private club during most of the day? This did not make sense as I have used hotel lounges around the world with no such problems.
reviews.title: From the Best to the Worst IC Hotels

likes.liked: — A room with a view of Sydney Harbor Bridge and Sydney Opera

reviews.text: As it was a 3 night stay, I asked if there would be any change the following nights and I was advised to ask again.
reviews.title: Beautiful roof top views
Five Star - Absolutely
reviews.text: When I subsequently asked about platinum benefits on the second night, I received the same answer as the first night that the hotel was full. This is the most irritating point is that I believe we were lied to about the later 2 nights as I had previously checked availability for these nights, outside of the hotel and discovered that the full range of rooms to be available. Of course I pointed out I had just checked this but received the same incorrect answer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, room was lovely, a little overpriced but service was very good, found restaurants to be quite expensive, great place to stay if you are going to the Opera House/Rocks or Circular Quay, lovely old building
reviews.title: Excellent location, a little overpriced, georgous old building

reviews.text: This is truly a five-star hotel - no pretences here! The room I stayed in was spacious with an impeccable interior. I had room service breakfast every morning, which was exceptional. The location is great - a short stroll to the train and bus stations as well as the ferry stops - enabling you to get just about anywhere you want to in Sydney. The hotel restaurants were great and the service was exceptional. Service throughout the hotel was great, with the one exception of front reception, where the staff were not helpful in any way. However, everything else is above par and I only wish I had time to get to the gym and the pool which looked great...will do this next time.
reviews.title: Definitely the place to stay.

likes.disliked: — Some of the front reception staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney for 3 nights during our honeymoon in May 2005. The room itself was well appointed, and the bathroom was quite nice. I was surprised at the bigger-than-average room size. My only quibbles were with the room location (considering we were on our honeymoon, we got a room barely with a view) and the overall snootiness of the staff. We are a generally down-to-earth couple, and prefer staff that are more like us. Considering the number of choices in Sydney, we probably won't stay there again, but it is a reasonable pick for anyone unfamiliar with Sydney and doesn't want to take chances.
reviews.title: Very Nice but Overpriced

reviews.text: One day, it has been a good hotel, but today...
reviews.title: Completly inflated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, my daughter and I are travelling all over the world since the beginning of august 2006 and we could not be sure to be in Sydney for the New Year eve before end of November 2006. I wanted to give us the best New Year eve that we had never had.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with beautifully decorated rooms. Location is great--right near Circular Quay and the Rocks area.
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms--but don't eat there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was very over-priced--recommend going elsewhere to eat. We stayed during a busy weekend and the hotel refused to honor my Platinum rewards card. There are a few shops in the hotel, including a Bose store. The shops themselves were very reasonably priced for tourist type goods--better than most other stores.
reviews.title: Right in the center of EVERYTHING!

reviews.text: Yes, this is probably more of a business hotel, but you cannot beat the location! Book a room with a view (we were in 1826), because when you marry the view with the location, the beds, and the bathroom, this is an incredible hotel.
reviews.title: Stylish and Clean, although very busy

reviews.text: We found check-in/check-out to be very easy and the staff extremely helpful and pleasant. Evening turn-down service (oddly we seemed to always be in when they came by) was very pleasant with chocolates and bottles of water. Pool is OK, as is the gym - but if you are touring around, you'll get plenty of exercise. The hotel is perfectly located for access to the Circular Quay - and you can get anywhere from here.
reviews.title: Very nice indeed

reviews.text: The bathroom was a decent size, with nice toiletries and a roomy shower - plus a cute little glass window so you could look out to the view as you brushed your teeth! The room was pretty spacious and the window seat was excellent. The best part had to be the bed - it was sumptuous. Coupled with the black-out blinds, you couldn't help but get a great night's sleep!
reviews.title: Nice...

description: The award winning InterContinental Sydney blends contemporary style with 19th century architecture and offers sweeping views from Sydney Harbour Bridge to the Pacific Ocean. A perfect base for work and play, InterContinental Sydney is bordered by the city s commercial centre, Circular Quay and the Royal Botanic Gardens. Steps away is the historic Rocks area, Sydney Opera House, the Art Gallery of NSW, leading shops and boutiques and some of the finest restaurants this Harbour city has to offer.
